input:
Question: Can you tell me the ingredients I need for a recipe? 
 Context: Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 onion, chopped, 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, 1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes, 12 small chile peppers, diced  (optional), 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 1 bunch green onions, chopped, 1/2 pint heavy cream, 6 (6 inch) corn tortillas, 3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, 1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce, 
Directions: 0) Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch strips. 1) Place in a medium bowl with desired marinade, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. 2) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 3) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 4) Saute chicken and onions until chicken is evenly brown. 5) Stir in diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, stewed tomatoes, chile peppers, soup and broth. 6) Bring mixture to a boil. 7) Reduce heat, cover skillet, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. 8) Remove chicken from skillet, and shred when cool enough to handle. 9) Meanwhile, allow skillet mixture to simmer and reduce to about 2 1/4 cups. 10) In a medium bowl, combine shredded chicken and about 1/4 cup skillet mixture (just enough to make a paste like mixture). 11) Mix together with half the chopped green onions. 12) Pour remaining 2 cups of skillet mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. 13) In a second skillet, heat cream over low heat, being careful not to boil. 14) Dip tortillas in the warm cream to soften and coat. 15) Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture onto each tortilla. 16) Top chicken mixture with half the shredded cheese, and roll up tortillas. 17) Place rolled tortillas in baking dish, seam side down, and drizzle with enchilada sauce. 18) Cover with remaining shredded cheese, and sprinkle remaining chopped green onion over cheese. 19) Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
conv_answer: In total there are 13 ingredients: first you will need 4 boneless chicken breast halves.
target_answer: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves

Directions: 0) Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch strips. 1) Place in a medium bowl with desired marinade, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. 2) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 3) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 4) Saute chicken and onions until chicken is evenly brown. 5) Stir in diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, stewed tomatoes, chile peppers, soup and broth. 6) Bring mixture to a boil. 7) Reduce heat, cover skillet, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. 8) Remove chicken from skillet, and shred when cool enough to handle. 9) Meanwhile, allow skillet mixture to simmer and reduce to about 2 1/4 cups. 10) In a medium bowl, combine shredded chicken and about 1/4 cup skillet mixture (just enough to make a paste like mixture). 11) Mix together with half the chopped green onions. 12) Pour remaining 2 cups of skillet mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. 13) In a second skillet, heat cream over low heat, being careful not to boil. 14) Dip tortillas in the warm cream to soften and coat. 15) Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture onto each tortilla. 16) Top chicken mixture with half the shredded cheese, and roll up tortillas. 17) Place rolled tortillas in baking dish, seam side down, and drizzle with enchilada sauce. 18) Cover with remaining shredded cheese, and sprinkle remaining chopped green onion over cheese. 19) Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
conv_answer: Yes, let it marinade for at least 30 minutes.
target_answer: 1) Place in a medium bowl with desired marinade, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

predictions: 2) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions: 0) Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch strips. 1) Place in a medium bowl with desired marinade, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. 2) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 3) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 4) Saute chicken and onions until chicken is evenly brown. 5) Stir in diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, stewed tomatoes, chile peppers, soup and broth. 6) Bring mixture to a boil. 7) Reduce heat, cover skillet, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. 8) Remove chicken from skillet, and shred when cool enough to handle. 9) Meanwhile, allow skillet mixture to simmer and reduce to about 2 1/4 cups. 10) In a medium bowl, combine shredded chicken and about 1/4 cup skillet mixture (just enough to make a paste like mixture). 11) Mix together with half the chopped green onions. 12) Pour remaining 2 cups of skillet mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. 13) In a second skillet, heat cream over low heat, being careful not to boil. 14) Dip tortillas in the warm cream to soften and coat. 15) Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture onto each tortilla. 16) Top chicken mixture with half the shredded cheese, and roll up tortillas. 17) Place rolled tortillas in baking dish, seam side down, and drizzle with enchilada sauce. 18) Cover with remaining shredded cheese, and sprinkle remaining chopped green onion over cheese. 19) Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
conv_answer: Chop 1 bunch of green onions and mix it together with the chicken.

Question: Ok I have 12 leaves cabbage, what is next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 12 leaves cabbage, 1 cup cooked white rice, 1 egg, beaten, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup minced onion, 1 pound extra-lean ground beef, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, 1 1/4 teaspoons ground black pepper, 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 
Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of water to a boil. 1) Boil cabbage leaves 2 minutes; drain. 2) In large bowl, combine 1 cup cooked rice, egg, milk, onion, ground beef, salt, and pepper. 3) Place about 1/4 cup of meat mixture in center of each cabbage leaf, and roll up, tucking in ends. 4) Place rolls in slow cooker. 5) In a small bowl, mix together tomato sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce. 6) Pour over cabbage rolls. 7) Cover, and cook on low 8 to 9 hours.
conv_answer: Next two are 1 beaten egg and one fourth of a cup of milk.
target_answer: 1 egg, beaten

Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of water to a boil. 1) Boil cabbage leaves 2 minutes; drain. 2) In large bowl, combine 1 cup cooked rice, egg, milk, onion, ground beef, salt, and pepper. 3) Place about 1/4 cup of meat mixture in center of each cabbage leaf, and roll up, tucking in ends. 4) Place rolls in slow cooker. 5) In a small bowl, mix together tomato sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce. 6) Pour over cabbage rolls. 7) Cover, and cook on low 8 to 9 hours.

Question: I got the ingredients ready, what should I do next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 12 ounces dry fettuccine pasta, 1 pound lean ground beef (optional), 1 cup chopped onion, 1 cup red bell pepper, chopped, 1 tablespoon butter, 1 (29 ounce) can diced tomatoes, 1 (4 ounce) can sliced mushrooms, 3 tablespoons chopped black olives, 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1/4 cup beef broth, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 
Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. 1) Cook pasta for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente; drain. 2) In a large skillet, brown beef over medium heat. 3) Drain fat from pan, and transfer meat to a bowl. 4) In the same skillet, cook onion and bell pepper in butter until tender. 5) Stir in tomatoes, mushrooms, olives, and  beef, and season with oregano. 6) Simmer for 10 minutes. 7) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 8) Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 9) Arrange half of the cooked fettuccine in the prepared dish, top with half of the beef and vegetable mixture, and sprinkle with 1/2 cup of Cheddar cheese and 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese. 10) Repeat layers. 11) Mix together soup and beef broth until smooth, and pour over casserole. 12) Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. 13) Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until heated through.
conv_answer: Good. Next is 1 cup chopped onion, 1 cup red bell pepper, chopped, and 1 tablespoon butter.
target_answer: 1 cup chopped onion

predictions: 1 (29 ounce) can diced tomatoes
labels: 1 cup chopped onion

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (176 degrees C) 1) In a medium bowl, mix together 2/3 cup butter, 1/4 cup white sugar, and 1 1/4 cup flour until evenly crumbly. 2) Press into 9 inch square baking pan. 3) Bake for 20 minutes. 4) In a 2 quart saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, and sweetened condensed milk. 5) Bring to a boil. 6) Continue to boil for 5 minutes. 7) Remove from heat and beat vigorously with a wooden spoon for about 3 minutes. 8) Pour over baked crust (warm or cool). 9) Cool until it begins to firm. 10) Melt chocolate and pour over caramel layer. 11) Cover the layer completely. 12) Chill. 13) Cut into squares (about 48 - small because it is rich).

input:
Question: Ok! I prepared the large eggs. 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 3 eggs, 7/8 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground allspice, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 cups chopped dried figs, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 1 cup confectioners' sugar for rolling, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 1) Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. 2) In a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar until thick and pale. 3) Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, cloves, cinnamon and allspice; blend into the egg mixture along with the vanilla. 4) Finally fold in the chopped figs and walnuts. 5) Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly. 6) Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly toasted. 7) When cool, cut into squares and roll the squares in confectioners' sugar.
conv_answer: The next 3 are 1/8 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves and 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon.
target_answer: 1/8 teaspoon salt

Question: How many ingredients does the recipe for the mix of two different places have? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup ketchup, 4 tablespoons unsweetened pineapple juice, 4 tablespoons molasses, 2 tablespoons dark rum, 2 tablespoons prepared Dijon-style mustard, 2 cloves garlic, chopped, salt and pepper to taste, 8 chicken thighs, 
Directions: 0) To Make Glaze: In a medium bowl combine the ketchup, pineapple juice, molasses, rum, mustard and garlic. 1) Season with salt and pepper to taste and mix well. 2) Place chicken pieces in a lightly oiled 9x13 inch baking dish; brush both sides with prepared glaze, using about 1/2 of the glaze. 3) Cover dish and refrigerate to marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. 4) Also, refrigerate remaining glaze. 5) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 6) Lightly brush chicken pieces on one side with some of the reserved glaze and bake uncovered in preheated oven for about 25 minutes. 7) Turn pieces, brush with remaining glaze and bake for another 25 minutes or until chicken is tender. 8) Preheat oven to broil. 9) Put chicken under broiler and lightly brown on both sides, about 2 to 3 minutes each side.
conv_answer: Yes, you know that I always have the funkiest recipes for you! The recipe has 8 ingredients. The first two are half a cup of ketchup and 4 tablespoons unsweetened pineapple juice.
target_answer: 1/2 cup ketchup

predictions: 4 tablespoons unsweetened pineapple juice
labels: 4 tablespoons molasses

Directions: 0) To Make Glaze: In a medium bowl combine the ketchup, pineapple juice, molasses, rum, mustard and garlic. 1) Season with salt and pepper to taste and mix well. 2) Place chicken pieces in a lightly oiled 9x13 inch baking dish; brush both sides with prepared glaze, using about 1/2 of the glaze. 3) Cover dish and refrigerate to marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. 4) Also, refrigerate remaining glaze. 5) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 6) Lightly brush chicken pieces on one side with some of the reserved glaze and bake uncovered in preheated oven for about 25 minutes. 7) Turn pieces, brush with remaining glaze and bake for another 25 minutes or until chicken is tender. 8) Preheat oven to broil. 9) Put chicken under broiler and lightly brown on both sides, about 2 to 3 minutes each side.
conv_answer: Next you cover dish the and refrigerate to marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. You also have to refrigerate the remaining glaze.

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 1) Lightly grease a medium baking sheet. 2) Cut a slit in each jalapeno pepper. 3) Remove and discard seeds and pulp. 4) In a medium bowl, mix sausage, baking mix, Cheddar cheese, crushed red pepper, and garlic salt. 5) Stuff jalapenos with the Monterey Jack cheese cubes. 6) Shape sausage mixture around the jalapenos to form balls. 7) Arrange jalapeno balls on the prepared baking sheet. 8) Bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly browned.

Question: How should I start making the Roasted Butterflied Leg of Lamb? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/4 cup olive oil, 8 cloves garlic, minced, 2 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, 2 tablespoons ground cumin, 1 tablespoon dried oregano, 1 (8 pound) leg of lamb, boned and butterflied to a more or less even thickness, 4 3/4 to 5 1/2 pounds trimmed weight, fell and most fat removed, 1 lemon, juiced, Minced fresh parsley, cilantro or mint  (optional), 
Directions: 0) Mix oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano; spread paste on both sides of the lamb and let stand for an hour until meat comes to room temperature. 1) Adjust oven rack to upper or upper-middle position (depending on lamb's thickness) and preheat broiler on high for at least 10 minutes. 2) Place lamb, cut side up, on a large wire rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan. 3) Broil, moving pan so entire surface browns evenly, about 8 minutes. 4) Turn lamb over; continue to broil until well browned on the other side, about 8 minutes longer. 5) Turn off broiler, remove lamb from oven and let rest for 10 minutes. 6) Heat oven to 325 degrees. 7) Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven. 8) Roast for a total of 50 minutes to 1 hour, until thermometer registers a rosy-pink 140 degrees. 9) Check lamb several times after 30 minutes. 10) If lamb gets done sooner, simply turn down oven to 170 degrees until ready to serve. 11) As soon as lamb comes out of the oven, squeeze on lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh herbs. 12) Carve, slicing across the grain when possible. 13) Arrange on a platter, drizzle with accumulated juices, and serve.
conv_answer: Hi. the first step is to mix some oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano.

Directions: 0) Mix oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano; spread paste on both sides of the lamb and let stand for an hour until meat comes to room temperature. 1) Adjust oven rack to upper or upper-middle position (depending on lamb's thickness) and preheat broiler on high for at least 10 minutes. 2) Place lamb, cut side up, on a large wire rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan. 3) Broil, moving pan so entire surface browns evenly, about 8 minutes. 4) Turn lamb over; continue to broil until well browned on the other side, about 8 minutes longer. 5) Turn off broiler, remove lamb from oven and let rest for 10 minutes. 6) Heat oven to 325 degrees. 7) Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven. 8) Roast for a total of 50 minutes to 1 hour, until thermometer registers a rosy-pink 140 degrees. 9) Check lamb several times after 30 minutes. 10) If lamb gets done sooner, simply turn down oven to 170 degrees until ready to serve. 11) As soon as lamb comes out of the oven, squeeze on lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh herbs. 12) Carve, slicing across the grain when possible. 13) Arrange on a platter, drizzle with accumulated juices, and serve.
conv_answer: Place a thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb.
target_answer: 7) Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven.

 Context: Ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil, 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated large crescent roll dough, 8 ounces Brie cheese, 1 bunch fresh spinach, rinsed and stems removed, 4 (1/2 ounce) slices prosciutto, 
Directions: 0) Heat oil in a heavy skillet; or spray a nonstick frying pan with cooking spray. 1) Saute chicken breasts until no longer pink, and juices run clear; set aside. 2) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 3) Unroll 4 large crescent rolls. 4) Layer each with 3 thin slices brie, 3 leaves spinach and 1 slice prosciutto. 5) Place chicken breast in the center of dough. 6) Wrap and tuck dough around chicken until completely enclosed. 7) Place seam side down on baking sheet. 8) Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until golden brown.

Question: How large should the package of small chocolate chip cookies be? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 (18 ounce) package small chocolate chip cookies, 1/4 cup margarine, melted, 1 cup hot fudge topping, 2 quarts vanilla ice cream, 1 cup whipped cream, 12 cherries, 
Directions: 0) Crush half the cookies (about 20) to make crumbs. 1) Combine crumbs with melted margarine and press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan or pie plate. 2) Stand remaining cookies around edge of pan. 3) Spread 3/4 cup fudge topping over crust. 4) Freeze 15 minutes. 5) Meanwhile, soften 1 quart of ice cream in microwave or on countertop. 6) After crust has chilled, spread softened ice cream over fudge layer. 7) Freeze 30 minutes. 8) Scoop remaining quart of ice cream into balls and arrange over spread ice cream layer. 9) Freeze until firm, 4 hours or overnight. 10) To serve, garnish with remainder of fudge topping, whipped cream and cherries.
conv_answer: The package should be 18 ounces.
target_answer: 1 (18 ounce) package small chocolate chip cookies

 Context: Ingredients: 6 pounds tart apples, cored and sliced, 6 cups apple cider, 3 cups white sugar, 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ground cloves, 
Directions: 0) Place the apples in a Dutch oven. 1) Pour in the cider. 2) Bring to a boil and cook on medium heat 30 minutes, or until soft. 3) Press the softened mixture through a food mill. 4) Continue cooking at a medium boil for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 5) Mix in the sugar, cinnamon and cloves. 6) Continue cooking over low heat until the sugar dissolves, stirring frequently. 7) Cook until the desired thickness has been attained. 8) Refrigerate the finished apple butter in sterile containers.

Question: Besides 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, which are the next two ingredients? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon light brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water, 1 cup skim milk, 3 egg whites, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 bananas, peeled and sliced, 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries, 
Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
conv_answer: The next ingredients are 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon salt and 2 tablespoons unsalted butter.
target_answer: 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon

Question: Ok good! They are ready. What next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup water, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 eggs, 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix, 2 1/2 cups cold milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 3 tablespoons hot water, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
conv_answer: 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 eggs and 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix.
target_answer: 1/4 teaspoon salt

labels: 2 1/2 cups cold milk

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
conv_answer: Now you should tip the dough onto the cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips.
target_answer: 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips.

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
conv_answer: Now you should stir in hot water one tablespoon at a time. Keep on doing this until the icing becomes smooth and it reaches the desired consistency.
target_answer: 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency.

Question: What's the first step to getting ready? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1 cup milk, 1 egg, beaten, 1/4 cup butter, melted and cooled, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 quarts oil for deep frying, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 cup white sugar, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, stir together the flour, 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder, salt, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon and nutmeg. 1) Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, butter, and vanilla. 2) Mix until well blended. 3) Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. 4) Heat oil in a deep heavy skillet or deep-fryer to 370 degrees F (185 degrees C). 5) On a floured board, roll chilled dough out to 1/2 inch thickness. 6) Use a 3 inch round cutter to cut out doughnuts. 7) Use a smaller cutter to cut holes from center. 8) Fry doughnuts in hot oil until golden brown, turning once. 9) Remove from oil to drain on paper plates. 10) Combine the remaining 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/2 cup sugar in a large resealable bag. 11) Place a few warm donuts into the bag at a time, seal and shake to coat.
conv_answer: First take a large bowl so we can add some ingredients to prepare the batter.

input:
Question: How should I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 (4 pound) chicken, cut into pieces, garlic powder to taste, 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced, 1 large onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon dried basil, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 teaspoon garlic salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning, 1 cup dry white wine, 1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 
Directions: 0) Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. 1) Sprinkle chicken with garlic powder, and brown on both sides. 2) Remove chicken to paper towels. 3) Spoon off chicken fat, and return pan to stove. 4) Stir in mushrooms and onions; cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft. 5) Remove to a medium bowl. 6) In a separate bowl, mix together basil, oregano, rosemary, and thyme. 7) Season with garlic salt, pepper, and poultry seasoning. 8) Stir in wine, and add to onion and mushrooms. 9) Return chicken to Dutch oven. 10) Pour mushroom mixture and broth over chicken; cover, and cook over low heat until meat begins to fall off the bone, about 1 1/2 hours.
conv_answer: We can start by preparing the ingredients! There's 14 of them. The first to prepare are 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1 (4 pound) chicken, cut into pieces.
target_answer: 2 tablespoons olive oil

Question: Ok good. What are the next 6 russet potatoes? 
 Context: Ingredients: 6 russet potatoes, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 egg, lightly beaten, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 pinch salt, 
Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. 1) Drop in potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. 2) Drain, cool slightly, and peel. 3) Season with salt, then mash potatoes with fork. 4) Place in large bowl, and stir in egg and olive oil. 5) Knead in enough flour to make a soft dough. 6) On a floured surface, roll dough into a long rope. 7) Cut the rope into 1/2-inch pieces. 8) Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. 9) Drop in gnocchi, and cook until they float to the top, about 3 to 5 minutes. 10) Serve with pasta sauce.
conv_answer: The others are 1 egg, lightly beaten.1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 pinch salt.

 Context: Ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons finely chopped onion, 1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1/4 cup salsa, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 2 tablespoons butter, divided, 8 (8 inch) flour tortillas, 1 1/2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided, 
Directions: 0) Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. 1) Stir in onion, and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. 2) Stir in beans and corn, then add sugar, salsa, and pepper flakes; mix well. 3) Cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. 4) Melt 2 teaspoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. 5) Place a tortilla in the skillet, sprinkle evenly with cheese, then top with some of the bean mixture. 6) Place another tortilla on top, cook until golden, then flip and cook on the other side. 7) Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
conv_answer: You start by heating oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.

Question: How do I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups quick-cooking oats, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 3/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1/2 cup shortening, 2 tablespoons water, 1 tablespoon raisins, 1 tablespoon mini semisweet chocolate chips, 
Directions: 0) In a medium bowl, stir together the oats, flour, baking soda and brown sugar. 1) Cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles cornmeal. 2) There should be no lumps of shortening left. 3) Measure 1/2 cup of the mixture into re-sealable bags or containers for storage. 4) Label and date each bag. 5) To make the cookies, empty one package of the mix into a bowl. 6) Stir in 2 teaspoons of water, 1 tablespoon of raisins and 1 tablespoon of mini semisweet chocolate chips. 7) Mix well and shape teaspoonfuls of dough into small balls. 8) Place balls on an ungreased cookie sheet and flatten with the buttered bottom of a glass dipped in sugar. 9) Follow you oven's instructions for baking.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups quick-cooking oats, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 3/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1/2 cup shortening, 2 tablespoons water, 1 tablespoon raisins, 1 tablespoon mini semisweet chocolate chips, 
Directions: 0) In a medium bowl, stir together the oats, flour, baking soda and brown sugar. 1) Cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles cornmeal. 2) There should be no lumps of shortening left. 3) Measure 1/2 cup of the mixture into re-sealable bags or containers for storage. 4) Label and date each bag. 5) To make the cookies, empty one package of the mix into a bowl. 6) Stir in 2 teaspoons of water, 1 tablespoon of raisins and 1 tablespoon of mini semisweet chocolate chips. 7) Mix well and shape teaspoonfuls of dough into small balls. 8) Place balls on an ungreased cookie sheet and flatten with the buttered bottom of a glass dipped in sugar. 9) Follow you oven's instructions for baking.
conv_answer: Now you should stir in 3 ingredients. Start with 2 teaspoons of water.
target_answer: 6) Stir in 2 teaspoons of water, 1 tablespoon of raisins and 1 tablespoon of mini semisweet chocolate chips.

predictions: 6) Stir in 2 teaspoons of water, 1 tablespoon of raisins and 1 tablespoon of mini semisweet chocolate chips.

Question: What's the first step? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 (9 inch)  pie shells, baked, 3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 eggs, 1 cup sour cream, 3 tablespoons white sugar, 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) In a medium mixing bowl, whip cream cheese until fluffy. 2) Add 1/2 cup sugar and vanilla extract. 3) Mix until smooth. 4) Add eggs. 5) Beat until all ingredients are thoroughly combined. 6) Pour mixture into pastry shells. 7) Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. 8) Remove and let stand for 5 minutes. 9) In a small bowl, combine sour cream and 3 tablespoons sugar. 10) Mix well, then spread half of mixture over each pie. 11) Turn off oven. 12) Place pies in oven for 15 minutes. 13) Remove and chill overnight. 14) Before serving, top each pie with 1 cup of strawberries.
conv_answer: First you can already preheat the oven and set it on 175 degrees Celsius.

Directions: 0) Prepare biscuits (enough to make 4 cups crumbled), and one 8x8 inch pan cornbread according to package directions. 1) Cool and crumble. 2) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 3) In a small pot, combine onion, celery, margarine and chicken broth. 4) Bring to boil and cook vegetables until tender. 5) In a 2-quart casserole dish, combine 4 cups crumbled cornbread, 4 cups biscuit crumbs, salt, pepper, sausage, chopped eggs and sage. 6) Pour broth and vegetables over bread mixture, and stir until combined. 7) Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes.

Question: Nice. How do I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 8 medium beets, 1 pound unsalted butter, 1 1/2 cups minced Vidalia onions, 4 Bosc pears - peeled, cored and minced, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/2 cup cranberry vinegar, 1 teaspoon salt, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 1) Wash beets, and place in a roasting pan. 2) Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until tender. Set aside to cool. 3) Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. 4) Stir in onion, pears, sugar, and vinegar; cook, stirring frequently, for 20 minutes. 5) When the beets are cool enough to handle, peel and coursely chop. 6) Puree onion mixture in a food processor with metal blade. 7) Add salt and 1/2 of the beets; pulse 4 to 5 times. 8) Add remaining beets, and pulse 2 to 3 times.
